member.summary: Publishes an object (value) into cache under the specified data identifier.
member.typeparam: The type of the stored object.

member.name: M:Log4Pro.CoreComponents.Caching.Cache.Read``1(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the specified value (by data identifier) from cache.
member.typeparam: The type of the stored object.

member.name: M:Log4Pro.CoreComponents.Caching.Cache.RemoveFromCache(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an object (value) from cache under the specified data identifier.

member.name: P:Log4Pro.CoreComponents.Caching.Cache.AutoPublisher
member.summary: The automatic publisher action. You can set an "AutoPublisher" action. This action able to gives back the value based on data-identifier. When you set this no more necesary preload the cache value by call "Publish" method. Simply set this property and implement an working publisher action logic. When you call the "Read" method the first time, the "AutoPublisher" load the value by this data-identifier into cache.

member.name: P:Log4Pro.CoreComponents.Redis.RedisConnectionAppSettings.Connection
member.summary: The connection as Stackexchange Redis connectionstring.

summary.strong: The pool deepness. It defines how many ConectionMultiplexers provide for this connection.
summary.para: See the 6th point of @JonCole's guide here.

summary.strong: It specifies an time after which drop and recreat an unworking ConnectionMultiplexer object.
summary.para: See the @JonCole's guide here. Here is the relevant sentence:
"We have seen a few rare cases where StackExchange.Redis fails to reconnect after a connection blip (for example, due to patching). Creating a new ConnectionMultiplexer will fix the issue."
